channel.title: Client while trying to run Client
channel.description:
when i try to run my client i got this message.
Error occurred initialization of VM Could not reserve enough space for object heap Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Client while trying to run Client
item.dc:creator: @ElmosWorld ElmosWorld
item.description:
@ElmosWorld wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:4, topic:422967”][quote author=ElmosWorld link=topic=525626.msg3827056#msg3827056 date=1322264975]

i knew what the problem was, but just to be sure, i googled it. you probably need to reserve more heap space. -Xmx flag will resolve the problem.

credits: http://www.star.bris.ac.uk/~mbt/stilts/sun256/jvmArgs.html
[/quote] I read about it I don’t really understand what it’s saying.

read right under where it says “memory size”

include that flag with the other arguments you pass into java.exe[/quote] oh i see thanks

Read full topic
item.source: Client while trying to run Client

item.title: Client while trying to run Client
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“ElmosWorld, post:3, topic:422967”][quote author=lemme_winks_ link=topic=525626.msg3827055#msg3827055 date=1322264838]
i knew what the problem was, but just to be sure, i googled it. you probably need to reserve more heap space. -Xmx flag will resolve the problem.

credits: http://www.star.bris.ac.uk/~mbt/stilts/sun256/jvmArgs.html
[/quote] I read about it I don’t really understand what it’s saying.[/quote]
read right under where it says “memory size”

include that flag with the other arguments you pass into java.exe

Read full topic
